content.question: Show all your work. Indicate clearly the methods you use, because you will be scored on the correctness of your methods as well as on the accuracy and completeness of your results and explanations.Rosebushes are known to produce rose blooms during their blooming period. A botanist (plant expert) plans to examine the number of rose blooms during the blooming period for a certain variety of rosebush. A previous publication states that the population distribution of the number of rose blooms during the blooming period for this variety of rosebush is skewed to the left with mean <math alttext="mu equals 22" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>μ</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>22</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and standard deviation <math alttext="sigma equals 5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>σ</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.(a) Compare the shapes of the sampling distributions of the sample mean number of rose blooms during the blooming period for random samples of <math alttext="4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> rosebushes and for random samples of <math alttext="80" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>80</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> rosebushes from the population.

frqParts.text: Show all your work. Indicate clearly the methods you use, because you will be scored on the correctness of your methods as well as on the accuracy and completeness of your results and explanations.Rosebushes are known to produce rose blooms during their blooming period. A botanist (plant expert) plans to examine the number of rose blooms during the blooming period for a certain variety of rosebush. A previous publication states that the population distribution of the number of rose blooms during the blooming period for this variety of rosebush is skewed to the left with mean <math alttext="mu equals 22" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>μ</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>22</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and standard deviation <math alttext="sigma equals 5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>σ</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.(a) Compare the shapes of the sampling distributions of the sample mean number of rose blooms during the blooming period for random samples of <math alttext="4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> rosebushes and for random samples of <math alttext="80" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>80</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> rosebushes from the population.

(b) Which of the following would be less likely to obtain from the population?• A random sample of <math alttext="49" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>49</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> rosebushes having a mean number of rose blooms during the blooming period that is less than <math alttext="24" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>24</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>or• A random sample of <math alttext="64" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>64</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> rosebushes having a mean number of rose blooms during the blooming period that is less than <math alttext="24" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>24</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>Justify your answer.

The botanist conducted a study to investigate whether there is a difference between the number of rose blooms during the blooming period for rosebushes of this variety when one of two types of fertilizers is applied to the soil. The botanist randomly assigned <math alttext="70" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>70</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> rosebushes of this variety from a local nursery to receive one of the two fertilizers just before the blooming period, with <math alttext="35" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>35</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> receiving an organic fertilizer and <math alttext="35" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>35</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> receiving a conventional fertilizer. An employee of the nursery, who was not aware of each rosebush’s assigned fertilizer, counted the number of rose blooms observed during the blooming period on each rosebush. The results of the study are shown in the following boxplots. (c) Based on the boxplots, write a few sentences comparing the distributions of the number of rose blooms during the blooming period for the rosebushes that received the organic fertilizer and the rosebushes that received the conventional fertilizer.

The botanist will conduct a hypothesis test to investigate whether the sample data provide convincing statistical evidence that the mean number of rose blooms during the blooming period is different for rosebushes receiving the organic fertilizer rather than the conventional fertilizer.(d) Name the appropriate hypothesis test and state, in words, the hypotheses.

Assume the conditions for inference have been met. A <math alttext="98" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>98</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> percent confidence interval for the difference in the mean numbers of rose blooms during the blooming period (organic fertilizer minus conventional fertilizer) was calculated to be <math alttext="negative 4.543 plus or minus 3.932" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>4.543</mn><mo>±</mo><mn>3.932</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.(e) Based only on this confidence interval, is the difference in the mean numbers of rose blooms during the blooming period statistically significant? Justify your answer.
(f) Can the findings of this study be generalized to all rosebushes of this variety? Explain why or why not.

topic.text: 1.9: Comparing Distributions of a Quantitative Variable

skill.text: Skill 1.F: Identify null and alternative hypotheses.
